datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to riddles, brain teasers, and mystery challenges.

columns.name: country_of_participant
columns.description: Country from which the participant is

columns.name: difficulty_levels_encountered
columns.description: Number of different difficulty levels encountered by the participant

columns.name: daily_puzzle_time_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of daily free time the participant devotes to solving puzzles

columns.name: cognitive_skill_level
columns.description: Assessed cognitive skill level of the participant, ranging from beginner to expert.

columns.name: english_fluency_level
columns.description: Fluency level of English language of the participant, on a scale of 1 to 10

columns.name: education_level
columns.description: Highest level of education attained by the participant

columns.name: time_dedication
columns.description: Estimated time in minutes the participant is willing to dedicate to solving a single puzzle session.

columns.name: uses_guided_help
columns.description: Indicates whether the participant prefers using guided help while solving puzzles.

columns.name: days_since_last_puzzle
columns.description: Number of days since the participant last solved a puzzle

columns.name: participation_in_puzzle_competitions
columns.description: Whether the participant regularly competes in puzzle competitions

columns.name: brain_training_frequency
columns.description: Number of times per week the participant engages in brain training activities

columns.name: previous_experience
columns.description: Whether the participant has solved similar puzzles in the past

columns.name: average_solve_time
columns.description: Average time taken by the participant to solve puzzles, in minutes

columns.name: frequent_mind_games
columns.description: Indicates whether the participant frequently engages in mind-challenging games like chess, sudoku, etc.

columns.name: problem_solving_score
columns.description: Score obtained in problem-solving games, scaled from 0 to 100

columns.name: number_of_puzzles_solved
columns.description: Total number of puzzles solved by the participant

columns.name: linguistic_interest
columns.description: Indicates whether the participant has a higher interest in linguistic activities

columns.name: prefers_quick_tasks
columns.description: Indicates if the participant prefers quick tasks over detailed ones

columns.name: prefers_puzzle_themes
columns.description: The types of puzzle themes preferred by the participant, ranging from logical, abstract, to sequential.

columns.name: enjoys_variety
columns.description: Indicates if the participant enjoys a variety of puzzles

columns.name: active_in_puzzle_community
columns.description: Whether the participant is active in online or local puzzle-solving communities

columns.name: puzzle_complexity_preference
columns.description: Participant's preference for puzzle complexity on a scale from 1 (simple) to 10 (most complex).

columns.name: puzzle_solving_frequency
columns.description: How often the participant engages in solving puzzles per week

columns.name: participant_age
columns.description: Age of the participant.

columns.name: logical_thinking_activity
columns.description: Indicates if the participant engages in activities that involve logical thinking.

columns.name: logical_preference_score
columns.description: Score that reflects the participant's preference for logical reasoning, between 1 to 10

queries.question: What is the relationship between the number of puzzles solved and the enjoyment of variety in cryptic puzzles?
queries.true_hypothesis: Participants who have solved over 50 puzzles and encountered more than 3 difficulty levels tend to enjoy a variety of puzzles.
